author: mcosgray@thetexan.news (Mary Elise Cosgray)
title: Justice Department Finds Texas Juvenile Justice Department Violated Children's Constitution Rights
text:
Five Texas Juvenile Justice Centers were found by the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) to be violating the U.S. Constitution in its treatment of detained minors.
In a lengthy
report on the Texas Juvenile Justice Department (TJJD), the DOJ found the TJJD infringed upon children’s constitutional rights in five locations across Texas as well as violated the Individuals with Disabilities Act (IDEA), and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).
